intro: Strobilanthes scopulicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the limestone hills of Peninsular Malaysia. It is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is known for its short blooming period. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
